subject: Marketing
title: The Elaboration Likelihood Model
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Elaboration Likelihood Model.

hook.text: Two psychologists mapped every persuasion attempt into just two mental routes.

buildup.text: The central route uses logic and evidence. The peripheral route uses shortcuts and cues.

discovery.text: Which route wins depends on how motivated the audience is to think deeply.

twist.text: Most ads target the peripheral route because people rarely analyze commercials.

climax.text: A strong argument convinces thinkers. A celebrity endorsement convinces everyone else.

punchline.text: Know which route your audience is taking.

quiz.question: What does the peripheral route of persuasion rely on?
options: Shortcuts and cues like celebrity endorsements
